title: Ketanji Brown Jackson: The Supreme Court Nominee’s Rulings
sub_head: A look at some noteworthy excerpts from Judge Jackson’s writings as both a district and appellate judge
body:
Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson joined the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, one of the nation’s most influential courts, last June. She previously served eight years as a federal judge in Washington, D.C., where she wrote more than 550 opinions.
Here are excerpts from some notable opinions.
